intro: Asystasia varia, commonly known as the variable asystasia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in spikes at the ends of the branches. Asystasia varia is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and compact growth habit. It prefers moist, well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight.
